page.title: 12Hawes Wood
page.content: The largest wood in the whole area is{Hawes Wood.}It covers about 12 acres. We circled the wood and noticed many varieties of wild flowers growing there. Wild honeysuckle and dogrose added their perfume to the atmosphere. Other June flowers included blue forget-me-not, scarlet pimpernel, red campion,yellow buttercups and white cow parsley, making a colourful array. This deciduous wood was at its most beautiful with oak, field maple, hazel and beech trees in full leaf. Very little, other than ferns and black- berry bushes, is growing amongst the trees.The small trees, field-maple and hazel, are intermingled around the perimeter. The taller trees, beech and oak, make up the main part of the wood.Many small birds and animals live there too, eating the nuts and fruit.
